turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Glomerella cingulata.
turn.1: What is the importance of knowing the species Glomerella cingulata?
turn.2: Looking specifically at some of the more economically important hosts proves this pathogen is a huge problem for growers all over the world.
turn.3: Can you give me some examples?
turn.4: A 2012 study done in southern Nigeria found 60% of surveyed mango trees showed symptoms of anthracnose and 34% of the fruit found on these trees displayed advanced degrees of infection.
turn.6: A large portion of this anthracnose was due to "C. gloeosporioides", specifically, as 96 of 231 fungal isolates taken from symptomatic tissue were identified as "C. gloeosporioides".
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: For strawberries produced in China, "C. gloeosporioides", along with "Colletotrichum acutatum", and "Colletotrichum fragariae" cause up to 80% of plant loss in strawberry nurseries, and over 40% of yield loss in field.
turn.10: In just these two examples this pathogen is causing millions of dollars in losses.
turn.12: When the species' entire host range is considered the economic impact cannot be overstated.
